metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: History of Robots
Industrial Robots
Industrial robots have been around for more than 50 years.
content.html: Industrial robots have been around for more than 50 years.

content.text: The first robot patent was applied for in 1954 and granted in 1961.
content.html: The first robot patent was applied for in 1954 and granted in 1961.

content.text: In 1969, Victor Scheinman invented the Stanford Arm (Stanford University), and in 1972 he designed the MIT Arm for the MIT Artificial Intelligence Lab.
content.html: In 1969, Victor Scheinman invented the Stanford Arm (Stanford University), and in 1972 he designed the MIT Arm for the MIT Artificial Intelligence Lab.

content.text: These "robots" are not considered intelligent. They are electrical machines designed to permit 6-axis arm movement. But the new design allowed for a machine to follow a programmed path and opened up for "robot jobs" like car painting, welding and assembly.
content.html: These "robots" are not considered intelligent. They are electrical machines designed to permit 6-axis arm movement. But the new design allowed for a machine to follow a programmed path and opened up for "robot jobs" like car painting, welding and assembly.

content.text: The pioneering robot company Unimation (with support from General Motors) took the Scheinman's design to the marked as the PUMA (Programmable Universal Machine for Assembly).
content.html: The pioneering robot company Unimation (with support from General Motors) took the Scheinman's design to the marked as the PUMA (Programmable Universal Machine for Assembly).

content.text: Most industrial robots are non-intelligent .
Most modern robots are said to be autonomous or semi-autonomous because they do not require much human input after they have been programmed.
content.html: Most modern robots are said to be autonomous or semi-autonomous because they do not require much human input after they have been programmed.

content.text: A robot can easily be programmed to do a lot of different things (like on an assembly line), but it will never change what it is doing. It will continue to the same job until you turn it off.
content.html: A robot can easily be programmed to do a lot of different things (like on an assembly line), but it will never change what it is doing. It will continue to the same job until you turn it off.

content.text: Robotic Bartenders on Quantum of the Seas - Royal Caribbean:
content.html: Robotic Bartenders on Quantum of the Seas - Royal Caribbean:

content.text: Robots and Artificial Intelligence are two different things.
content.html: Robots and Artificial Intelligence are two different things.

content.text: Robot technology is not a subset of Artificial Intelligence.
content.html: Robot technology is not a subset of Artificial Intelligence.

content.text: A robot is a physical thing. After 50 years of development, almost anything is programmable, your radio, your watch, your phone, and even robots.
content.html: A robot is a physical thing. After 50 years of development, almost anything is programmable, your radio, your watch, your phone, and even robots.

content.text: AI Robots
Artificial Intelligence can be built into robots, and AI is a very exciting field in future robotics.
content.html: Artificial Intelligence can be built into robots, and AI is a very exciting field in future robotics.

content.text: Hanson Robotics' Sophia personifies some dreams for the future of AI.
content.html: Hanson Robotics' Sophia personifies some dreams for the future of AI.

content.text: Sophia is a combination of science, engineering, and artistry. She is a human-crafted science fiction character depicting the future of AI and robotics.
content.html: Sophia is a combination of science, engineering, and artistry. She is a human-crafted science fiction character depicting the future of AI and robotics.

content.text: Can AI Robots Interact Socially?
Yes, AI Robots can learn to interact socially.
content.html: Yes, AI Robots can learn to interact socially.

content.text: Kismet (a MIT robot) is programmed to understand body language and voice inflection. The creators study how human and babies interact, based on tone of speech and visual cue.
content.html: Kismet (a MIT robot) is programmed to understand body language and voice inflection. The creators study how human and babies interact, based on tone of speech and visual cue.

content.text: Kismet could be the foundation of a human-like learning system.
content.html: Kismet could be the foundation of a human-like learning system.
